alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 1:44PM CST until March 06 at 7:12PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Major flooding begins. Some low lying parts of Danville, residences and businesses in the flood plain, may be affected. Bailey Branch Road, East 13th Street, Corinth Road, and the industrial park near McCargo Branch flooded. State Highways 27 and 80 may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet just late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 25.1 Fri 12 PM 23.9 20.1 18.9 26.0 12 AM 3/04 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
